definitions.definition: a cold dessert (= a sweet dish) made from cake and fruit with layers of jelly, custard and cream

examples.text: He was just a trifle too friendly for my liking.

definitions.definition: something that is not valuable or important

examples.text: There’s no point worrying over such trifles.
$1 000 is a mere trifle to her.

wordOrigin: Middle English (also denoting an idle story told to deceive or amuse): from Old French trufle, by-form of trufe ‘deceit’, of unknown origin. The verb derives from Old French truffler ‘mock, deceive’.
